result.execSummary:
The defendant Nelly J. Makalin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

No contact with victims, K.A.S., N.A.S., and/or N.A.P, their residence or their place of employment. 
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Sex offender treatment assessment and comply with recommendaitons.
Comply with the Sex Offender Registry.
Comply with any other assessment, treatment and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas and Deptment of Corrections.
Sign release of  information forms for offender's assessments and /or treatment.
Pay all court costs 90 days prior to release.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
 AODA & comply with treatment recommendations and while confined comply with other treatments counseling of the prison system.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Count 1 & 6, but consecutive to any other sentence
Concurrent with: with Count 1 & 4, but consecutive to any other sentence

Defendant Nelly J. Makalin appeared by phone, from Fox Lake Correctional. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for State of Wisconsin.

8:49 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Defendant wrote a motion for relief because they are withholding more than 25% of new monies in his prison account.
Defendant is objecting saying that they cannot do that.
Defendant has nothing further to say, has put it all in his motion.
January 30, 2023 is Defendant's release date.

Atty Mukoski addresses the Court, by per statute, the prison system can collect more than 25%.

BY THE COURT:
Relief requested by Defendant, is denied.

8:52 AM Court is in recess.
from Defendant
Hearing on December 14, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Motion for Injunction Preventing Invalid Withholdings of Inmate Funds - pro se

Defendant Nelly J. Makalin #570304 appeared by phone. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Ryan Wetzsteon appeared for State of Wisconsin.

1:21 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Defendant is currently located at Fox Lake Correctional Institution.

Court explains the reason for this hearing. Defendant wrote a letter to the Court, requesting relief from Dept of Corrections, they are taking more than 25% of new monies out of prison account. Defendant is arguing that this is contrary to law.

Atty Wetzsteon addresses the Court, refers to 18Wis Appeals Decision 20. State vs. Williams

Court concurs with the State.

Court does not have authority to hear this. 
Defendant made a complaint to the office in the prison regarding this and was told to contact the Court first.

BY THE COURT:
Court cannot grant request today.

records.addlTxt:
2:22 p.m. Defendant Nelly J. Makalin in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Nelly J. Makalin in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed PSI report. ADA Knaapen informs the Court that victims have been informed and provides the Court a copy of letter from Victim.  Atty Renc states corrections to the Court. 
2:24 p.m. ADA Knaapen reads victim letter on the record.
2:44 p.m. Atty Renc makes sentencing statements and requests sentences to be concurrent.
2:47 p.m. Defendant makes apologetic statements.

2:51 p.m.********PRISON****
Count 1: 10 yrs Prison Sentence at 5 yrs Incarceration & 5 yrs Extended Supervision, consecutive to any other sentence
Conditions:
No contact with victims, K.A.S., N.A.S., and/or N.A.P, their residence or their place of employment. 
 Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
 AODA & comply with treatment recommendations and while confined comply with other treatments counseling of the prison system.
Sex offender treatment assessment and comply iwth recommendaitons.
Comply with the Sex Offender Registry.
Comply with any other assessment, treatment and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas and Deptment of Corrections.
Sign release of  information forms for offender's assessments and /or treatment.
Pay costs, & DNA surcharge at 25 % prison account.
Pay all court costs 90 days prior to release.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.

Count 4: 2 yr Prison Sentence at 1 yr Incarceration & 1 yr Extended Supervision, concurrent to counts 1 & 6, but consecutive to any other sentence. Same conditions as Count 1. Pay costs + DNA surcharges.

Count 6:  2 yr Prison Sentence at 1 yr Incarceration & 1 yr Extended Supervision, concurrent to counts 1 & 4, but consecutive to any other sentence. Same conditions as Count 1. Pay costs + DNA surcharges.

No jail credit.
Not eligible for challenge or Early release program.
Appeal rights provided.
Truth & Sentencing

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 08-25-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Nelly J. Makalin in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Nelly J. Makalin in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:39 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

State files Amended Information. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  Received a copy of the amended information and waives its reading. 

Defendant enters a plea of: Counts 1, 4 & 6 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court questions Defendant regarding language. 
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Defendant agrees with prior convictions for repeater status.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1, 4 & 6.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 2, 3 & 5 are dismissed and read-in. 
Court orders a PSI.  
PSI to be completed by 8/11/15 with copies forwarded to counsel to prepare for sentencing arguments. 
Bond is revoked. 
Atty Knaapen indicates there was a felony OWI conviction where a PSI may have been done in 2011. 
Atty Renc concurs.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
